courses.name: Computer Science 101
courses.description: Introduction to programming and computer science fundamentals.

questions.explanation: The post-increment operator (x++) returns the value of x before the increment. So printf prints 5, and then x becomes 6.

questions.question: Which data structure is most suitable for implementing a LIFO (Last In First Out) approach?
questions.explanation: A stack follows the Last In First Out (LIFO) principle, where the last element added is the first one to be removed.

questions.question: What is the time complexity of binary search?
questions.explanation: Binary search has a time complexity of O(log n) because in each step, it halves the search space.

questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, which is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a valid CSS selector?
questions.explanation: !element is not a valid CSS selector. The valid selectors are .class (for class), #id (for id), and * (universal selector).

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'DOCTYPE' declaration in HTML?
options: To declare the document type and version of HTML
questions.explanation: The DOCTYPE declaration is used to tell the browser what version of HTML the page is written in.

questions.question: Which of these is not a JavaScript data type?
questions.explanation: Float is not a distinct data type in JavaScript. JavaScript has Number which can represent both integers and floating-point numbers.

questions.question: What will be the output of: console.log(typeof null)?
questions.explanation: In JavaScript, typeof null returns 'object', which is actually a historical bug in the language that was never fixed for backward compatibility.

questions.question: What is closure in JavaScript?
options: A way to secure JavaScript code
A function having access to the parent scope, even after the parent function has closed
A method to close browser windows
A technique to terminate JavaScript execution
questions.explanation: A closure in JavaScript is a function that has access to its outer function's scope, even after the outer function has returned.

questions.question: Which design pattern is used to create an object in one step instead of multiple steps?
questions.explanation: The Builder pattern is used to create complex objects step by step, where the steps can be combined to create different representations of the object.

questions.question: What is the main benefit of using the MVC (Model-View-Controller) architecture?
questions.explanation: MVC architecture separates an application into three main components: Model (data), View (UI), and Controller (logic), making the code more modular, reusable, and easier to test and maintain.

questions.question: Which SOLID principle states that a class should have only one reason to change?
questions.explanation: The Single Responsibility Principle (SRP) states that a class should have only one reason to change, meaning it should have only one responsibility or job.

courses.name: Mathematics 101
courses.description: Fundamentals of mathematics including algebra, calculus, and statistics.

questions.question: Solve for x: 2x + 5 = 15
questions.explanation: To solve for x, subtract 5 from both sides: 2x = 10. Then divide both sides by 2: x = 5.

questions.question: What is the value of y when y = x² + 2x - 3 and x = 2?
questions.explanation: Substitute x = 2 into the equation: y = 2² + 2(2) - 3 = 4 + 4 - 3 = 5

questions.question: What is the derivative of f(x) = x²?
questions.explanation: The power rule for derivatives states that if f(x) = xⁿ, then f'(x) = n·xⁿ⁻¹. For f(x) = x², n = 2, so f'(x) = 2x¹ = 2x.
